content.text:
which type of  water in the <image 1> is located on the surfaces of individual soil particles. And this type of water is largely unavailable to plants because it is held firmly by molecular attractions so strong that they can not be broken by plants or through evaporation. 

A. Gravitational water
B. Capillary water
C. Hygroscopic water

The type of water located on the surfaces of individual soil particles and largely unavailable to plants due to strong molecular attractions is:

C. Hygroscopic water

Hygroscopic water is held tightly to soil particles by adhesion and is not available for plant uptake. This is evident from the description in the image, which states that "Water held by adhesion is not available to plants."
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
